etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in Blackwood's Magazine. From leg + -let

definitions: A little or short leg, especially the leg of a young child.
A ring or band worn around the leg, typically as an ornamental accessory. Compare "anklet", "armlet".
Chiefly in plural (now somewhat rare). Each of a pair of coverings for the lower legs. Compare "legging".
A piece of armour for the (lower) leg.
